info.description: Build custom integrations with the LaunchDarkly REST API
info.title: LaunchDarkly

get.description: You can issue a GET request to the root resource to find all of the resource categories supported by the API.

200.description: A list of links to available resources in the API.

parameters.description: A timestamp filter, expressed as a Unix epoch time in milliseconds. All entries returned will have before this timestamp.
parameters.name: before

parameters.description: A timestamp filter, expressed as a Unix epoch time in milliseconds. All entries returned will have occured after this timestamp.
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: Text to search for. You can search for the full or partial name of the resource involved or fullpartial email address of the member who made the change.
parameters.name: q

parameters.description: A limit on the number of audit log entries to be returned, between 1 and 20.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: A resource specifier, allowing you to filter audit log listings by resource.
parameters.name: spec

description.example: Changed the name from Test to Testing

get.summary: Get a list of all audit log entries. The query parameters allow you to restrict the returned results by date ranges, resource specifiers, or a full-text search query.

parameters.description: The resource ID.
parameters.name: resourceId

description.example: Changed the name from Test to Testing

get.summary: Use this endpoint to fetch a single audit log entry by its resouce ID.

parameters.description: The project key, used to tie the flags together under one project so they can be managed together.
parameters.name: projectKey

parameters.description: The environment key, used to tie together flag configuration and users under one environment so they can be managed together.
parameters.name: environmentKey

name.description:
| Name     | Description |
| --------:| ----------- |
| new      | the feature flag was created within the last 7 days, and has not been requested yet |
| active   | the feature flag was requested by your servers or clients within the last 7 days |
| inactive | the feature flag was created more than 7 days ago, and hasn't been requested by your servers or clients within the past 7 days |
| launched | one variation of the feature flag has been rolled out to all your users for at least 7 days |

get.summary: Get a list of statuses for all feature flags. The status includes the last time the feature flag was requested, as well as the state of the flag.

parameters.description: The project key, used to tie the flags together under one project so they can be managed together.
parameters.name: projectKey

parameters.description: The environment key, used to tie together flag configuration and users under one environment so they can be managed together.
parameters.name: environmentKey

parameters.description: The feature flag's key. The key identifies the flag in your code.
parameters.name: featureFlagKey

200.description: Status of the requested feature flag.

name.description:
| Name     | Description |
| --------:| ----------- |
| new      | the feature flag was created within the last 7 days, and has not been requested yet |
| active   | the feature flag was requested by your servers or clients within the last 7 days |
| inactive | the feature flag was created more than 7 days ago, and hasn't been requested by your servers or clients within the past 7 days |
| launched | one variation of the feature flag has been rolled out to all your users for at least 7 days |

get.summary: Get the status for a particular feature flag.

parameters.description: The project key, used to tie the flags together under one project so they can be managed together.
parameters.name: projectKey

parameters.description: By default, each feature will include configurations for each environment. You can filter environments with the env query parameter. For example, setting env=production will restrict the returned configurations to just your production environment.
parameters.name: env

parameters.description: Filter by tag. A tag can be used to group flags across projects.
parameters.name: tag

creationDate.description: A unix epoch time in milliseconds specifying the creation time of this flag.

description.example: This flag controls whether test feature is turned on or not.

trackEvents.description: Set to true to send detailed event information for this flag.

kind.description: Whether the feature flag is a boolean flag or multivariate.

maintainerId.description: The ID of the member that should maintain this flag.

tags.description: An array of tags for this feature flag.

temporary.description: Whether or not this flag is temporary.

variations.description: The variations for this feature flag.

description.example: The true variation

get.summary: Get a list of all features in the given project.

parameters.description: The project key, used to tie the flags together under one project so they can be managed together.
parameters.name: projectKey

includeInSnippet.description: Whether or not this flag should be made available to the client-side JavaScript SDK.

key.description: A unique key that will be used to reference the flag in your code.

name.description: A human-friendly name for the feature flag. Remember to note if this flag is intended to be temporary or permanent.

tags.description: Tags for the feature flag.

temporary.description: Whether or not the flag is a temporary flag.

variations.description: An array of possible variations for the flag.

description.example: The true variation

parameters.description: The project key, used to tie the flags together under one project so they can be managed together.
parameters.name: projectKey

parameters.description: The feature flag's key. The key identifies the flag in your code.
parameters.name: featureFlagKey

delete.summary: Delete a feature flag in all environments. Be careful-- only delete feature flags that are no longer being used by your application.

parameters.description: The project key, used to tie the flags together under one project so they can be managed together.
parameters.name: projectKey

parameters.description: The feature flag's key. The key identifies the flag in your code.
parameters.name: featureFlagKey

parameters.description: By default, each feature will include configurations for each environment. You can filter environments with the env query parameter. For example, setting env=production will restrict the returned configurations to just your production environment.
parameters.name: env

creationDate.description: A unix epoch time in milliseconds specifying the creation time of this flag.

description.example: This flag controls whether test feature is turned on or not.

trackEvents.description: Set to true to send detailed event information for this flag.

kind.description: Whether the feature flag is a boolean flag or multivariate.

maintainerId.description: The ID of the member that should maintain this flag.

tags.description: An array of tags for this feature flag.

temporary.description: Whether or not this flag is temporary.

variations.description: The variations for this feature flag.

description.example: The true variation

patch.summary: Perform a partial update to a feature.

requestBody.description: Requires a JSON Patch representation of the desired changes to the project, and an optional comment. 'http://jsonpatch.com/' Feature flag patches also support JSON Merge Patch format. 'https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7386' The addition of comments is also supported.

get.summary: Returns a list of all members in the account.

items.description: The 20-hexdigit id or the key for a custom role.
An action to perform on a resource.

notactions.description: Targeted actions will be those actions NOT in this list. The "actions" field must be empty to use this field.

items.description: An action to perform on a resource.

notresources.description: Targeted resource will be those resources NOT in this list. The "resources`" field must be empty to use this field.

parameters.description: The member ID.
parameters.name: memberId

delete.summary: Delete a team member by ID.

parameters.description: The member ID.
parameters.name: memberId

get.summary: Get a single team member by ID.

parameters.description: The member ID.
parameters.name: memberId

patch.summary: Modify a team member by ID.

requestBody.description: Requires a JSON Patch representation of the desired changes to the project. 'http://jsonpatch.com/'

get.summary: Returns a list of all projects in the account.

requestBody.description: Project keys must be unique within an account.

delete.summary: Delete a project by key. Caution-- deleting a project will delete all associated environments and feature flags. You cannot delete the last project in an account.

post.summary: Create a new environment in a specified project with a given name, key, and swatch color.

color.description: A color swatch (as an RGB hex value with no leading '#', e.g. C8C8C8).

defaultTtl.description: The default TTL for the new environment.

key.description: A project-unique key for the new environment.

name.description: The name of the new environment.

get.summary: Search users in LaunchDarkly based on their last active date, or a search query. It should not be used to enumerate all users in LaunchDarkly-- use the List users API resource.

parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: This parameter is required when following "next" links.
parameters.name: h

parameters.description: This parameter is required when following "next" links.
parameters.name: scrollId

get.summary: List all users in the environment. Includes the total count of users. In each page, there will be up to 'limit' users returned (default 20). This is useful for exporting all users in the system for further analysis. Paginated collections will include a next link containing a URL with the next set of elements in the collection.

parameters.description: The feature flag's key. The key identifies the flag in your code.
parameters.name: featureFlagKey

_value.description: The most important attribute in the response. The _value is the current setting for the user. For a boolean feature toggle, this will be true, false, or null if there is no defined fallthrough value.

setting.description: The setting attribute indicates whether you've explicitly targeted this user to receive a particular variation. For example, if you have explicitly turned off a feature toggle for a user, setting will be false. A setting of null means that you haven't assigned that user to a specific variation.

get.summary: Fetch a single flag setting for a user by key.

parameters.name: userKey

parameters.name: featureFlagKey

put.summary: Specifically enable or disable a feature flag for a user based on their key.

setting.description: The variation value to set for the user. Must match the variation type of the flag.

on.description: Whether this webhook is enabled or not.

secret.description: If defined, the webhooks post request will include a X-LD-Signature header whose value will contain an HMAC SHA256 hex digest of the webhook payload, using the secret as the key.

tags.description: Tags assigned to this webhook.

url.description: The URL of the remote webhook.

get.summary: Fetch a list of all webhooks.

on.description: Whether this webhook is enabled or not.

secret.description: If sign is true, and the secret attribute is omitted, LaunchDarkly will automatically generate a secret for you.

sign.description: If sign is false, the webhook will not include a signature header, and the secret can be omitted.

url.description: The URL of the remote webhook.

parameters.description: The resource ID.

secret.description: If defined, the webhooks post request will include a X-LD-Signature header whose value will contain an HMAC SHA256 hex digest of the webhook payload, using the secret as the key.

tags.description: Tags assigned to this webhook.

url.description: The URL of the remote webhook.

description.example: Description of revenue team role here

key.description: The 20-hexdigit id or the key for a custom role.

items.description: An action to perform on a resource.

effect.description: Effect of the policy - allow or deny.

creationDate.description: A unix epoch time in milliseconds specifying the creation time of this flag.

description.example: This flag controls whether test feature is turned on or not.

trackEvents.description: Set to true to send detailed event information for this flag.

kind.description: Whether the feature flag is a boolean flag or multivariate.

maintainerId.description: The ID of the member that should maintain this flag.

tags.description: An array of tags for this feature flag.

temporary.description: Whether or not this flag is temporary.

variations.description: The variations for this feature flag.

description.example: The true variation

apiKey.description: The SDK key for backend LaunchDarkly SDKs.

color.description: The swatch color for the environment.

defaultTrackEvents.description: Set to true to send detailed event information for new flags.

key.description: The key for the environment.

mobileKey.description: The SDK key for mobile LaunchDarkly SDKs.

secureMode.description: Determines if this environment is in safe mode.

Root200.description: A list of links to available resources in the API.

creationDate.description: A unix epoch time in milliseconds specifying the creation time of this flag.

description.example: Users in this segment can access beta features.

excluded.description: An array of user keys that should not be included in this segment, unless they are also listed in "included".

included.description: An array of user keys that are included in this segment.

key.description: Unique identifier for the user segment.

rules.description: An array of rules that can cause a user to be included in this segment.

tags.description: An array of tags for this user segment.

on.description: Whether this webhook is enabled or not.

secret.description: If defined, the webhooks post request will include a X-LD-Signature header whose value will contain an HMAC SHA256 hex digest of the webhook payload, using the secret as the key.

tags.description: Tags assigned to this webhook.

url.description: The URL of the remote webhook.

After.description: A timestamp filter, expressed as a Unix epoch time in milliseconds. All entries returned will have occured after this timestamp.
After.name: after

AuditLimit.description: A limit on the number of audit log entries to be returned, between 1 and 20.
AuditLimit.name: limit

Before.description: A timestamp filter, expressed as a Unix epoch time in milliseconds. All entries returned will have before this timestamp.
Before.name: before

EnvironmentKey.description: The environment key, used to tie together flag configuration and users under one environment so they can be managed together.
EnvironmentKey.name: environmentKey

EnvironmentKeyQuery.description: By default, each feature will include configurations for each environment. You can filter environments with the env query parameter. For example, setting env=production will restrict the returned configurations to just your production environment.
EnvironmentKeyQuery.name: env

FeatureFlagKey.description: The feature flag's key. The key identifies the flag in your code.
FeatureFlagKey.name: featureFlagKey

HMAC.description: This parameter is required when following "next" links.
HMAC.name: h

Offset.description: Specifies the first item to return in the collection.
Offset.name: offset

ProjectKey.description: The project key, used to tie the flags together under one project so they can be managed together.
ProjectKey.name: projectKey

Q.description: Text to search for. You can search for the full or partial name of the resource involved or fullpartial email address of the member who made the change.
Q.name: q

ScrollId.description: This parameter is required when following "next" links.
ScrollId.name: scrollId

Spec.description: A resource specifier, allowing you to filter audit log listings by resource.
Spec.name: spec

Tag.description: Filter by tag. A tag can be used to group flags across projects.
Tag.name: tag

UserSegmentKey.description: The user segment's key. The key identifies the user segment in your code.
UserSegmentKey.name: userSegmentKey

patchMemberPatchdelta.description: Requires a JSON Patch representation of the desired changes to the project. 'http://jsonpatch.com/'
